basics.name: Haifeng Liu
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate · Brain-Computer Interface Researcher
basics.summary: Brain-computer interface researcher focusing on binocular-vision SSVEP paradigms, wearable EEG hardware, and VR/AR neurointerfaces to deliver perception-compute fused personal BCI platforms.

work.name: ShanghaiTech University / Chinese Academy of Sciences
work.summary: Joint Ph.D. program advancing VR-oriented SSVEP paradigms, wearable EEG hardware, and edge intelligence for immersive BCIs.
highlights: Designed binocular VR SSVEP paradigms that encode multiple targets with minimal frequencies to improve robustness and comfort.
Built Unity-based multi-scene EEG-BCI platforms and closed-loop VR/AR interaction systems leveraging Hololens and Pico headsets.
Developed FPGA and wireless EEG acquisition systems, multimodal sensing terminals, and edge inference pipelines for real-time decoding.

education.institution: ShanghaiTech University (Joint Ph.D. Program with CAS)
education.summary: Researching wearable BCI systems, VR/AR neurointerfaces, and perception-compute fused platforms.
Foundations in signal processing, embedded systems, and human–machine interaction.

publications.name: A Comparative Study of Stereo-Dependent SSVEP Targets and Their Impact on VR-BCI Performance
publications.summary: Quantifies how stereo-dependent targets influence accuracy, information transfer rate, and user comfort in VR-based SSVEP BCIs.

publications.name: A Novel SSVEP Modulation Method Utilizing VR-Based Binocular Vision
publications.publisher: IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBC)
publications.summary: Introduces dual-view SSVEP modulation that encodes nine VR targets with two frequencies, improving robustness under immersive conditions.

publications.name: Design and Implementation of a Scalable and High-Throughput EEG Acquisition and Analysis System
publications.summary: Presents an FPGA-based modular EEG acquisition platform tailored for lab-grade and clinical BCI deployments.

publications.name: High-Precision, Low-Threshold Neuromodulation With Ultraflexible Electrode Arrays for Brain-to-Brain Interfaces
publications.summary: Demonstrates ultraflexible electrode arrays enabling precise neuromodulation within brain-to-brain communication pipelines.

publications.name: A Novel Binocular-Encoded SSVEP Framework for Efficient VR-Based Brain-Computer Interface
publications.publisher: IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics
publications.summary: Accepted article detailing binocular encoding strategies that enhance throughput and robustness of VR-oriented BCIs.
